storyInfo: After learning about the patrol to the west, Alina heads east to exchange supplies. Once she's gone, Talulah hears that the village to the west is being searched and decides to ambush the patrol.

attributes.content: Hui-chieh:
I don't know how much further I have to go.
I can hear the winter feathers chirp every now and then. Is that supposed to mean something? Does it mean that spring will be here soon?
It's still very cold here, but it shouldn't be much longer until it starts to get warmer.
It's been three weeks. We've finally found two more villages willing to trade with the Infected.
We've set up camp at an abandoned settlement a few kilometers away from them. There's plenty of fuel here to last us a while.
You can't imagine how awful tree bark tastes. I don't ever want to listen to the old man tell me how nutritious they are anymore.
December 7th
I am very well aware where this road is taking us.
Nonetheless, we have to get to the end of the road. Even if I don't make it, Yelena, Alina, and Eno and Sasha as well... I am sure they will make it.
But the road beneath our feet is just way too murky and hard to see.
Will they reject us? We can't bring their hopes up too much.

It's a bad thing to make a promise you cannot fulfill. The Ursus Empire's promise about bread and bed was nothing more than a ruse to cover up their atrocities and lies. And lies are what lead to tyranny.

Will they come to loathe us? It's very likely. If it wasn't for how hard life is in the Northern Plains, people here would probably report the Infected to the Patrol Unit the moment they spotted them.
This kind of animosity probably came from how worried they are about their own situation.
I'm not like Buldrokkas'tee. We certainly need to be on the lookout and avoid that, but I don't believe that's in their nature.
We can't hold it against them just because they want to look out for themselves. Definitely not.
Will they try to hurt us? I have no idea. And it's probably not something I can worry about too much...
No matter the case... I think most people are only like that because of the circumstances they are in.
If they had a teacher like Alina, a team like ours, or the chance to live in harmony with Infected... I'm sure things would improve.
Most of them were simply brainwashed by Ursus's twisted ideology. We can help them. Knowledge can change the way people think.

It's just... it's a really difficult thing to do. That's even though I believe... if you always hold fast to your beliefs in your actions, getting everyone to accept the truth should be one of the simplest things to accomplish.
【The words above were crossed out. Naturally, the letter was never mailed out.】
Oh, good morning.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Wouldn't it be dangerous for you to head outside right now?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I talked to the soldiers, and they said the patrol unit all went to the village to the west. Did someone see you trading with them the other day?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: It's not impossible. Anyway, you should stay away from the west.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I know. I'll go to the village to the east instead. I should still be able to barter for some things there.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Oh, you don't need to worry so much. Remember, we used to find ourselves in situations much more dangerous.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: What are you trying to get this time?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Some canned fruits and dried vegetables.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...Are those things really worth heading outside for?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Our fighters will get sick if things don't improve soon. It's about time you pick up a few things about taking care of yourself...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: We're having trouble just getting enough food to feed ourselves. I really don't think we should go out of our way for....
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Now, Talulah, that's not right.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Uh huh, ahem—
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: 'It's precisely because there are times we don't get enough food on the table or even clothes to keep ourselves warm that things like songs, music, fruits, and flower, and our desire for all the things that delight our taste buds, our eyesight, and our sense of smell are so important.'
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: 'These are the things that remind us what we are fighting for: we're fighting so that everyone can lead a decent life.'
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Naturally, your health is part of all that. With just some vegetables and fruits, we can help a lot of people fight off their diseases.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: ...Rebutting me with my own words... That's cheating.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hey now... Cheating? That's quite a serious charge, isn't it? Here, say it after me: 'That's smart!'
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Okay, okay.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Do you need someone to go with you? A bodyguard, that is.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That probably isn't a good idea. I may be Infected, but I am not that special. I wouldn't want anyone to find out about us just because of me. Besides, it isn't too hard for me to hide my infection. Easier than for some of our soldiers.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Okay, but you should still be careful. I don't think we can completely trust the villagers there... There are a lot of things that don't add up there.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Yep, okay. Oh, I'll try to get us some pears too. Or do you reckon the Yetis like apples more?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I think they are more of a fan of raspberries... but let's not worry about them. They know how to look for those themselves.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I've got a meeting now.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Okay, I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: —Alina!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What's up?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'm thinking about putting together an Infected education group. Would you like to run it?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Huh? Am I really the right person for that?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: You have a much better reputation than me among the noncombatant Infected.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It'll be easier for me to introduce you to everyone.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's not what I mean...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Knowledge is a means of fighting itself, Alina. I insist.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: I'll leave the decision to you. I don't need to write up any speeches or anything, do I?
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: Oh, I can hear the applause already.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Stop teasing me. Okay, I'll get going now.
attributes.name: Alina

attributes.content: See you later. Don't stay out too late!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That won't work. We need to hang them.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: The captain isn't around right now, but I know that's what he'd order us to do.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Remember, guerrilla fighters. We are not an army. At least not yet.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It gives a bad impression. When they first joined us, it was because they trusted us. They only started having doubts because of hunger. That's the only reason they made this mistake.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It only happened because we didn't keep our end of the bargain.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What bargain? Feeding them what little food we have left?
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: We promised the Infected a place to stay.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Not everyone came here for a noble end. That's not realistic.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We could've earned even more of their trust if we had the machines exchanged for the provisions sooner.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: In any case, I cannot accept keeping them on the team.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Then let them go.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I won't tolerate any excessive violence. Also, give them enough rations for a week before you exile them.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Absolutely not! Not even our warriors get that kind of treatment!
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: We're not going to give in on this one. It has nothing to do with achievements or whatever. We simply can't abide by their behavior.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Fine. At least don't go overboard with the language. Don't chew them out too much.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...We can accept that.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Now that the patrols are trying to smoke us out to the west... we can't let them find the group of Infected there.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: That's all the more reason to put these bastards over...
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Hm? Someone's knocking.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: *Pant*...
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: Talulah!
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: It's the Patrol Unit! They're investigating the village that traded food with us!
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: Should we get out of here? If we leave now, we'll be long gone by the time they found out about us!
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: Draw the patrol unit our way. I'll ambush them somewhere close by. We must let the patrol squad think we're behind it all, even if we have to leave our tracks behind for them to find.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah! Think this through again! The Fourth Army's sentries are just ten kilometers away. Once they get word from the patrols about us, they will definitely come after us!
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: If the villages are pillaged because they gave us a helping hand... No, suppose they didn't. If they come in harm's way because of us, the Infected, we'll never find another village willing to trade with us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then let's take it upon ourselves to keep the news from spreading.
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: That's exactly how word about this gets out!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Listen to me. If you try to put a lid on this by killing everyone there, the bodies will become evidence. If you then get rid of their bodies, then the deserted village will be evidence instead.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If you want to keep any bad news about us from spreading, then there's only one way to go about it: Don't let anything bad happen in the first place.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: What we need to do now is to widen the path we have ahead of us, not just for ourselves, but also for the descendants of those who are following us down this path. Any questions?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: You have a point. Let's do that.
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Right, what you said just now makes sense. Protect all non-combatants, and help them evacuate first.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We have a tough battle ahead of us. I'll be fighting alongside you, but neither FrostNova and Patriot are here with us; remember, one day, you may not even have me fighting next to you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But as long as what you are fighting for is just and feasible, then we don't need anyone else by our side. You don't need anyone by your side.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Infected Fighter

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Talulah
